place.name: OSSINGTON
place.gazetteerText: OSSINGTON, a village and a parish in Southwell district, Notts. The village stands 2½ miles W N W of Carlton r. station, and 4 S S E of Tuxford; and has apostal letter-box under Newark. The parish comprises 2, 265 acres. Real property, £2, 515. Pop., 231. Houses, 42. The manor, with Ossington Hall, belonged formerly to the Cartwrights and the Cranmers, and belongs now to the Right Hon. J. E. Denison. The parish is a meet for the Rufford hounds. The living is a donative in the diocese of Lincoln. Value, not reported. Patron, the Right Hon. J. E. Denison. The church is a neat building, in the Grecian style; and has a tower. There is a parochial school. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
